byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from London, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and AUSTIN RAMZY

abstract: British government denies Chinese artist Ai Weiwei standard six-month business visa for neglecting to declare that he had been convicted of a crime; issues Ai an exceptional visa, which allows him to remain in Britain for 20 days.
lead_paragraph: The British government granted Mr. Ai a visa, but not a standard six-month business visa, saying he had neglected to declare that he had been convicted of a crime.

headline.main: Britain Limits Visit by the Chinese Artist Ai Weiwei
headline.print_headline: Britain Limits Chinese Artist to a Visit of 3 Weeks

snippet: The British government granted Mr. Ai a visa, but not a standard six-month business visa, saying he had neglected to declare that he had been convicted of a crime.
